channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping, 17th July
item.description:
Guess what has yet agin happened here overnight???? YES, more fly tipping. Why don’t you do something about this constant problem???

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 17th July
item.description:
We’ve been informed that a "No Waiting" post outside No. 32 High Street, Prestbury, requires either removal or resetting. We wanted to bring this to your attention so the appropriate action can be taken.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 17th July
item.description:
Good morning I am sure this has already been reported but yesterday morning this branch had fallen from the tree opposite my flat. It is on St George’s Rd Cheltenham and it’s obstructing the pathway. I just want to make the council aware as this will need to be removed. Thank you ¿¿ Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: No double yellows/demarking of no parking zone, 17th July
item.description:
... leading to cars parking right across the pavement. This is going to cause considerable trouble when the Co Op opens up - please can they be painted on ASAP. Can you please confirm that delivery vehicles will not be blocking the pavement when they arrive, as currently we don't understand where they will go. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Public Bin overflowing, 17th July
item.description:
Public bin needs emptying - overflowing - has been like this for a week or so
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 17th July
item.description:
This photograph (attached) serves to demonstrate the level of damage being done by (probably) foxes, and risk to electic cables etc. Is somebody going to inspect this please? Email received: resident of 26 Bibury Road has noticed that something has repeatedly been digging up the grass verge on the corner of Aldertom Road. It looks like it could be an animal, possibly a fox, and it keeps digging down exposing cables. Mr Unwin has repeatedly filled this hole in but he now fears that it could cause an accident if someone were to trip over it. Would it be possible for you and your team to provide a more permanent solution please.
Report on FixMyStreet
